basics.name: Caroline Seidenzahl
basics.label: Undergraduate Research Assistant
basics.summary: Honors student at Michigan State University double majoring in Electrical Engineering and Mathematics with a concentration in Biomedical Engineering and a minor in Computational Modeling and Data Science (CMSE). Research interests include signal processing, inverse problems, and optimization, with applications in biomedical imaging and neuroengineering.

work.name: Regenerative Electrode Interface Lab (PI: Dr. Erin Purcell), Michigan State University
work.summary: Work with electrophysiology and spatial transcriptomics data to study neural tissue response to implanted microelectrodes.
highlights: Astrocyte segmentation and morphology analysis using deep learning

work.name: HAWC Gamma Ray Observatory, Michigan State University
work.summary: Gamma-ray shower analysis for flare detection in the Cygnus Cocoon Region.

awards.title: Professorial Assistantship
awards.summary: Competitive undergraduate research position awarded to top Honors students.

projects.name: Mathematical Machine Learning (Honors Option Project)
projects.summary: Python notebooks combining mathematical explanations with code examples in signal and image processing.

projects.name: Personal Archiving & Digitization Service
projects.summary: Designed workflows for digitizing VHS/camcorder tapes and CDs/DVDs using OBS Studio, Python, and Lightbox galleries.
